series.series.name: PLUS: TRACK AND FIELD -- EASTERN STATES

abstract.p: Eastern States interscholastic track and field meet held, New Rochelle, NY; results noted (S)

block.p: Carlos Bedoya, Cardinal O'Hara and Camden High Schools registered impressive performances yesterday at the Eastern States boys' interscholastic outdoor championships in New Rochelle, N.Y.
Carlos Bedoya, Cardinal O'Hara and Camden High Schools registered impressive performances yesterday at the Eastern States boys' interscholastic outdoor championships in New Rochelle, N.Y.
Bedoya, who attended graduation ceremonies from Archbishop Stepinac in White Plains two hours after competing, easily won the 200-meter dash in 21.5 seconds.

Cardinal O'Hara of Springfield, Pa., a suburb of Philadelphia, running the 4x800-meter relay for only the second time this season, turned in an outstanding time of 7 minutes 47.5 seconds in winning the event. Transit Tech of Brooklyn was second in 7:49.4.
Camden won a duel with Mount St. Michael of the Bronx in the 4x400 relay, 3:17.4 to 3:19.8.
Marc Todaro of Iona Prep was the meet's only double winner. He took the discus throw at 160 feet 4 inches and the hammer throw at 166-1.
PLUS: TRACK AND FIELD -- EASTERN STATES
